## ‚ú® Features

- üßÆ **Finite Element Simulation:** Provides tools for simulating deformable objects using tetrahedral and triangular meshes with support for various elasticity models;
- üîÑ **Differentiable Physics:** Enables gradient-based optimization through automatic differentiation using JAX and Warp integration;
- ‚ö° **Efficient Optimization:** Implements advanced algorithms like Preconditioned Nonlinear Conjugate Gradient (PNCG) for real-time physics simulations;
- üéØ **Elasticity Models:** Features multiple material models including ARAP (As-Rigid-As-Possible) and active muscle simulation capabilities;
- üìä **Meshing & Visualization:** Integrates with PyVista for mesh processing and visualization, supporting both surface and volumetric meshes;
- üß© **Modular Design:** Offers a clean architecture with separated components for energies, optimizers, and geometry handling;

## üì¶ Installation

To install `liblaf-apple`, run the following command:

```bash
uv add liblaf-apple
```

## ‚å®Ô∏è Local Development

You can use Github Codespaces for online development:

[![](https://github.com/codespaces/badge.svg)](https://codespaces.new/liblaf/apple)

Or clone it for local development:

```bash
gh repo clone liblaf/apple
cd apple
mise run install
```
